word_mean: 原始型：一种典型的，原始的或标准的类型或形式

sentence.Network_en: She is the archetype of an American movie star.
Old Mr. Duff is the archetype of the elderly British gentleman.
sentence.Network_cn: 年迈的达夫先生是英国老绅士的典型代表.

sentence.Network_en: He came to this country 20 years ago and is the archetype of the successful Asian businessman.

本文运用神话—原型批评理论对寻根小说《小鲍庄》进行重读,旨在通过对洪水神话... This thesis uses myth-archetypal criticism of his theory to reread the ”.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: via Latin from Greek arkhetupon 'something moulded first as a model', from arkhe- 'primitive' + tupos 'a model'

entry.def: An archetype is something that is considered to be a perfect or typical example of a particular kind of person or thing, because it has all their most important characteristics.

example.ex: He came to this country 20 years ago and is the archetype of the successful Asian businessman.
example.tran: 他20年前来到这个国家，是成功亚裔商人的典范。

means.word_mean: 1. an original model on which something is patterned
